answers.author: Kelsey Rydland
answers.text:
Hello Sylvia,
Local governments in Illinois have developed an organization to address these very challenges. The GIS Consortium is a unique organization that consists of a collaborative of 21 member local governments working together to provide GIS. They range from 7,000 to 60,000 in population. You may find the following online resources of interest:
GIS Consortium
General information:  www.GISConsortium.org/public/ 
Use cases:  www.GISConsortium.org/bulletin/ 
MapOffice:  www.GISConsortium.org/mapoffice
Contacts:  www.GISConsortium.org/contact/
If you have any questions or would like to discuss further please feel free to get in touch with me and I can put you in contact with individuals that can help.
Best,
Kelsey

answers.author: Robert Kiely
answers.text:
Sylvia, we are a member of the GIS Consortium that Kelsey refers to and could not be happier with the quality of service we receive. Check-out MGPINC. Com
The struggle will be in getting a group of communities to join together as they are all likely in different places with thier GIS services. Good luck.

author: Sylvia Carrillo
text:
I recently began to manage a small City who has some serious GIS needs, however, is restricted (as we all are) on how much we can expend to get such a project off the ground. We have partnered with nearby communities who will share the base map information, however, need information on maintenance, etc. Does anyone have any insight to share on a GIS deployment in a small city, (less than 10K population)? Any insight is appreciated!
Thanks,
Sylvia
